page.title: 10Hamm Court Farm,Addlestone
page.content: Hamm Court Farm is now given over to the breeding of top class deer. There are three types of deer -{Scottish Red {Deer, Chinese Spotted Deer}and the very large{Elk. Deer are kept in fields surrounded by three metre high fences with an electric fence about two metres high and half a metre inside the large one. Fields are well watered because of the nursing females. One male serves about 40 females. The cost of a good breeding deer is about{Â£1000}and only the best are kept. Ear tags identify the deer and they are quite tame because they are hand-fed. The farm is very pretty and contains many wildfowl and game as well as the deer.
